verses.verse: In those days John the Baptist came preaching in the wilderness of Judah
saying, "Repent, for the Kingdom of Heaven is close at hand".
For this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet who said, "The voice of one shouting in the wilderness: prepare the way of the Lord; make his paths straight."
This same John had clothes of camel's hair and a leather belt around his waist. His food was locusts and wild honey.
Then Jerusalem, all Judah, and the entire region around the Jordan went to him.
They were baptized by him in the Jordan while confessing their sins.
But when many of the Pharisees and Sadducees came to his baptism, he said to them, "O generation of vipers, who has warned you to flee the coming wrath?
"Don't think to say within yourselves, "We have Abraham for our father," for I tell you that God is able to raise up children for Abraham from these stones.
"Now also the ax is laid to the root of the tree; therefore every tree that doesn't produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
"It's true that I baptize you with water at repentance, but he who comes after me is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry, he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit or fire.
"Whose winnowing shovel is in his hand. He will thoroughly clean his floor and gather his wheat into the granary, but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.
Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John in order to be baptized by him.
But John prevented him saying, "I have need to be baptized by you and you come to me?
Jesus answered him, "Allow it now, for it is proper for us to fulfill all righteousness like this." Then he allowed him.
After he was baptized, Jesus immediately got up out of the water and look the heavens were opened to him, and he saw the God's Spirit coming down like a dove and lighting on him.
And lo a voice from heaven that said, "This is my beloved Son in whom I am well pleased."
